p:
Tachyzoites of T. gondii RH strain were maintained by intraperitoneal passages in Balb/c mice and collected in phosphate‐buffered saline (PBS), pH 7.2, at 3–4 day intervals. Peritoneal fluid was obtained from the infected mice and centrifuged for 10 min at 200
g at room temperature. This centrifugation removed host cells and debris. Subsequently, the supernatant containing the parasites was collected and centrifuged for 10 min at 1,000
g . The pellet was washed in two stages, first with PBS at pH 7.2 and then RPMI‐1640 (Gibco, USA) without bovine fetal serum.
